oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Determining an Attacker’s Height from Angle of Stab Wound
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Risher, Claire
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this experiment, the angle of the knife in a stab wound was analyzed to determine if it correlated with the height of the attacker. The height of the victim was constant for all heights, 155, 165, 177, 187 centimeters, and respective trials. The wound was simulated by stabbing florist’s foam, used in place of flesh, three times at each height. After comparing the angle results with the height, it was found that the height increased along with the bottom angle of the knife. The direct correlation between the height of the attacker and the angle of the knife supported the hypothesis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Instars: A Journal of Student Research; Vol. 4 (2018): Instars: A Journal of Student Research
